00089 #ifndef _osconfig_
00090 #define _osconfig_
00091 
00092 /*
00093 ** Platform Configuration Parameters for the OS API
00094 */
00095 
00096 #define OS_MAX_TASKS                64
00097 #define OS_MAX_QUEUES               64 
00098 #define OS_MAX_COUNT_SEMAPHORES     20
00099 #define OS_MAX_BIN_SEMAPHORES       20
00100 #define OS_MAX_MUTEXES              20
00101 
00102 /*
00103 ** Maximum length for an absolute path name
00104 */
00105 #define OS_MAX_PATH_LEN     64
00106 
00107 /* 
00108 ** The maxium length allowed for a object (task,queue....) name 
00109 */
00110 #define OS_MAX_API_NAME     20
00111 
00112 /* 
00113 ** The maximum length for a file name 
00114 */
00115 #define OS_MAX_FILE_NAME    20
00116 
00117 /* 
00118 ** These defines are for OS_printf
00119 */
00120 #define OS_BUFFER_SIZE 172
00121 #define OS_BUFFER_MSG_DEPTH 100
00122 
00123 /* This #define turns on a utility task that
00124  * will read the statements to print from
00125  * the OS_printf function. If you want OS_printf
00126  * to print the text out itself, comment this out 
00127  * 
00128  * NOTE: The Utility Task #defines only have meaning 
00129  * on the VxWorks operating systems
00130  */
00131  
00132 #define OS_UTILITY_TASK_ON
00133 
00134 
00135 #ifdef OS_UTILITY_TASK_ON 
00136     #define OS_UTILITYTASK_STACK_SIZE 2048
00137     /* some room is left for other lower priority tasks */
00138     #define OS_UTILITYTASK_PRIORITY   245
00139 #endif
00140 
00141 
00142 /* 
00143 ** the size of a command that can be passed to the underlying OS 
00144 */
00145 #define OS_MAX_CMD_LEN 1000
00146 
00147 /*
00148 ** This define will include the OS network API.
00149 ** It should be turned off for targtets that do not have a network stack or 
00150 ** device ( like the basic RAD750 vxWorks BSP )
00151 */
00152 #define OS_INCLUDE_NETWORK
00153 
00154 /* 
00155 ** This is the maximum number of open file descriptors allowed at a time 
00156 */
00157 #define OS_MAX_NUM_OPEN_FILES 128
00158 
00159 /* 
00160 ** This defines the filethe input command of OS_ShellOutputToFile
00161 ** is written to in the VxWorks6 port 
00162 */
00163 #define OS_SHELL_CMD_INPUT_FILE_NAME "/ram/OS_ShellCmd.in"
00164 
00165 /* 
00166 ** This define sets the queue implentation of the Linux port to use sockets 
00167 ** commenting this out makes the Linux port use the POSIX message queues.
00168 */
00169 /* #define OSAL_SOCKET_QUEUE */
00170 
00171 /*
00172 ** This define sets the number of memory ranges that are defined in the memory range defintion
00173 ** table.
00174 */
00175 #define OS_MEM_TABLE_SIZE 10
00176 
00177 
00178 /*
00179 ** Module loader/symbol table is optional
00180 */
00181 #define OS_INCLUDE_MODULE_LOADER
00182 
00183 #ifdef OS_INCLUDE_MODULE_LOADER
00184    /*
00185    ** This define sets the size of the OS Module Table, which keeps track of the loaded modules in 
00186    ** the running system. This define must be set high enough to support the maximum number of
00187    ** loadable modules in the system. If the the table is filled up at runtime, a new module load
00188    ** would fail.
00189    */
00190    #define OS_MAX_MODULES 20
00191 #endif
00192 
00193 
00194 /*
00195 ** This define sets the maximum symbol name string length. It is used in implementations that 
00196 ** support the symbols and symbol lookup.
00197 */
00198 #define OS_MAX_SYM_LEN 64
00199 
00200 #endif
